means: 相信，信任( trust的现在分词)

sentence.Network_en: I set off for the valley, trusting to luck.
sentence.Network_cn: 我动身去山谷了，一切全凭运气。

sentence.Network_en: She nodded, not trusting her own voice.

entry.tran: 轻信的；容易相信别人的
entry.def: A trusting person believes that people are honest and sincere and do not intend to harm him or her.

example.ex: She has an open, trusting nature...
example.tran: 她天性坦率，容易相信别人。

means.word_mean: 1. inclined to believe or confide readily; full of trust;

sentences.sentence: "great brown eye, true and trustful"- Nordhoff & Hall
"she had an open and trusting nature"

auth_sentence.content: It is a trusting, sociable and active bird.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is a trusting, sociable and active bird.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is a trusting, sociable and active bird.

auth_sentence.content: I thought we stopped trusting a little bit offensively.

means.word_mean: 轻信的;轻易信赖别人的

sentences.en: You are too trusting;it’s one of the hard facts of life that not everybody is as honest as you are.
sentences.cn: 你太相信别人了,严酷的现实并不是每个人都像你那样诚实。

sentences.en: He was too trusting—or, to put it another way, he had no head for business.
sentences.cn: 他太轻信别人，或者换句话说，他没有商业头脑。
